title.narrative: Promotion of education right of indigenous peoples in the Santiago del Estero Province and supporting sustainable development of communities

description.narrative: The project aims to strengthen and consolidate functions of an agroecology school in Quimili in the province of Santiago del Estero whose students come from Vilela Lule-Vilela Sanaviron and Guaycuru indigenouspeoples communities. The school is located in t he grounds of the community Pueblo Vilela Pampa Pozo. It is maintained by these four indigenous peoples which also have established it for the purpose of giving integrated education for their young aged 16 to 25 to guarantee social and sustainable developm ent of communities and enable conditions for the young to stay in the region through advantages obtained by agroecology that enables livelihood and sustainable growth.The school provides the technical knowledge needed for the position of assistant in agroe gology. The local environment and its requirements are considerated in the education as well as the traditions and values of indigenous peoples. The school was established to fulfill educational needs of indigenous peoples' young and it is directed and de veloped by the four indigenous peoples in coordination with its students.The provincial government has granted the school with partial recognition but it doesn't finance its functions. The students travel once a month to the school to take part in the clas ses during one week while living in the school facilities. Rest of the month they practice in their communities what they have learned transfering knowledge right to the field. Once graduated they get technical support and the tools needed to fully implem ent the knowledge acquired to enable their own source of livelihood through sustainable small scale agriculture.The question of equality between men and women is taken into consideration and the participation of women is encouraged and promoted in all acti ons. Also the matter of equality is being dealt with in workshops that take place once a week during the school week. The aim is to reach 50 % of female students of new students.The goal is to increase the number of student from the current 80 per grade to 120 students and hence gain greater impact in the communities. To accomplish this and to assure the continuity of school's functions the objective is to obtain institutional support and official recognition for the school by the provincial government whic h is needed for state subsidy. Its required to enable the increase of the number of students since the capacity of the school and the communities is already fully utilised.
